body: FYI I just tried this on 5.1 and see the same behaviour. (ie 2 x T and 2 x W drives)

This issue also happens when you attach a storage device like HDD during a powershell session.

```
PS C:\> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17763
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0â€¦}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

PS C:\> Get-PSDrive D

Name           Used (GB)     Free (GB) Provider      Root                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    CurrentLocation
----           ---------     --------- --------      ----                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    ---------------
d                  71,00       2723,40 FileSystem    d:\
D                  71,00       2723,40 FileSystem    D:\

PS C:\> Get-Volume D

DriveLetter FriendlyName FileSystemType DriveType HealthStatus OperationalStatus SizeRemaining    Size
----------- ------------ -------------- --------- ------------ ----------------- -------------    ----
D           DISK1        NTFS           Fixed     Healthy      OK                      2.66 TB 2.73 TB

PS C:\>

```

Start a new session - issue is not present there anymore but stays in existing session.

I have a work around:
Get-PSDrive -Name s | sort-object -unique

```
PS C:\support\Scripts-dont-change> Get-PSDrive -Name s

Name           Used (GB)     Free (GB) Provider      Root                                               CurrentLocation
----           ---------     --------- --------      ----                                               ---------------
S                 125.50        834.44 FileSystem    \\DHCVPUHDI01\wug
s                 125.50        834.44 FileSystem    \\dhcvpuhdi01\wug


PS C:\support\Scripts-dont-change> Get-PSDrive -Name s | sort-object -unique

Name           Used (GB)     Free (GB) Provider      Root                                               CurrentLocation
----           ---------     --------- --------      ----                                               ---------------
s                 125.50        834.44 FileSystem    \\dhcvpuhdi01\wug

```
